content:
If you have 14 days to travel in Xi'an, here is a suggested itinerary that includes surrounding cities and popular tourist attractions:

Day 1: Arrival in Xi'an
Arrive in Xi'an, check into your hotel, and rest. In the evening, take a stroll around the Muslim Quarter, a bustling and lively neighborhood famous for its street food and local souvenirs.

Day 2: Xi'an City Tour
Visit the Terracotta Army, one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world, and learn about the history of the Qin Dynasty. In the afternoon, visit the ancient city walls, the Bell Tower, and the Drum Tower. End the day with a Tang Dynasty dinner show.

Day 3: Xi'an City Tour
Visit the Shaanxi History Museum, one of the best museums in China, to learn about the history and culture of Xi'an. In the afternoon, visit the Great Mosque and the Grand Mosque Quarter, which is the largest mosque in China.

Day 4: Luoyang City Tour
Take a high-speed train to Luoyang, which is known for its Longmen Grottoes, a UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring over 100,000 Buddhist statues carved into caves. You can also visit the White Horse Temple, one of the oldest Buddhist temples in China.

Day 5: Luoyang City Tour
Visit the Shaolin Temple, which is located in the nearby Songshan Mountains and is famous for its kung fu monks. You can watch a kung fu performance and explore the temple complex.

Day 6: Pingyao City Tour
Take a high-speed train to Pingyao, which is a well-preserved ancient city that is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Visit the Pingyao Ancient City Wall, Rishengchang Draft Bank Museum, and the Qiao Family Compound.

Day 7: Pingyao City Tour
Visit the Shuanglin Temple, a Buddhist temple that is famous for its over 2,000 painted clay figurines. You can also explore the local food and souvenirs in the old town.

Day 8: Hukou Waterfall Tour
Take a day trip to the Hukou Waterfall, which is the second-largest waterfall in China and is located on the Yellow River. You can take a boat ride and hike to get the best views.

Day 9: Xi'an City Tour
Return to Xi'an and visit the Small Wild Goose Pagoda and the Xi'an Museum. You can also walk around the Bell and Drum Tower Square, which is a popular spot for locals and tourists.

Day 10: Huashan Mountain Tour
Take a day trip to Huashan Mountain, which is one of China's five sacred mountains and is known for its steep cliffs and stunning views. You can take a cable car and hike to the summit.

Day 11: Famen Temple Tour
Visit the Famen Temple, which is famous for its Buddhist relics, including the finger bone of Sakyamuni Buddha. You can also explore the local area and visit the Yaozhou Kiln Ruins.

Day 12-13: Xi'an City Tour
Spend the last two days in Xi'an exploring any other attractions that you may have missed, such as the Banpo Museum or the Forest of Steles Museum. You can also walk around the ancient city walls or rent a bike and explore the local area.

Day 14: Departure from Xi'an
Check out of your hotel and depart from Xi'an to your next destination.

This itinerary is just a suggestion and can be adjusted based on your preferences and interests. Make sure to research any travel requirements and book accommodations and transportation in advance.
